{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3448941,"name":"Layton","username":"LaytonK737","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/aca169/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-18T19:46:19.331Z","cooked":"

The gear cartridge in the picture has two bearing that are in them when trying to put these on the column these bearings keep coming out.

These are swerve x flipped modules here’s a link to the page of the picture

docs.wcproducts.com

Step 6-9 | WCP Swerve X

Any help would be greatly appreciated thank you

IMG_0303828×606 57.6 KB

These are designed as a slip fit and are geometrically held in place when the module is assembled. If you want to keep them in place during assembly you can use loctite 603/638/648.

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

*Could also use super glue if you really wanted to as well.

It’s not letting it sit flush with the other stuff and allowing movement even when fully assembled that’s my main concern because with the other two we have built right now it was a easy slip on fit and doesn’t move now

I’m not following, here is a section view of the assembly:

image1439×823 103 KB

Red → Snap ring if you want to retain it together so it doesn’t move
Orange → Spacer included so its flush against the bearing
Green → Built in spacer
Blue → Gear Cartridge built in spacer

In this configuration the bearings have no where to go. Do you have pictures or more information? Also if you email support@wcproducts.com, one of the application engineers can verify all the information and walk you through it.
